description: Salmon works best in this citrus-flavored dish.
author: Country Boy

recipeName: Lemon Dill Salmon with Garlic, White Wine, and Butter Sauce
description: I had a craving for fresh fish and dill, so I played around and came up with this. Its been rated one of my greatest hits! Great with rice or potatoes and steamed green beans.
author: Countess

description: This recipe is not only easy but healthy and tasty! Paleo, gluten-free and dairy-free!
author: Health Nut

recipeName: Cucumber Cups with Dill Cream and Smoked Salmon
description: Classic combos are classic because the flavors go well together! Dill, cucumber, and smoked fish are combined with a bit of lemon to perk things up. Small pieces of smoked trout would be a good substitute for the salmon in this pretty, easy, no-cook hors d'oeuvre. Cucumber cups can be assembled and kept chilled in an airtight container 1 day ahead of time.
author: RuthE

recipeName: Mauigirl's Smoked Salmon Stuffed Pea Pods
description: These are a cute and fresh idea for an appetizer or as a pretty addition to a festive vegetable tray. I used to steam the pea pods, but this uncooked method yields a nicer look without all the fuss.
author: mauigirl

description: Steelhead trout, also know as freshwater salmon, smoked to perfection with garlic and rosemary flavors. After the overnight marinade and the brine soak, it is all just watching as it smokes.
author: SHADOWS1

description: Simple, tasty and fast! Salmon is sauteed with all ingredients at once, and served over couscous.  Great with a spinach salad.
author: AMAGICITY

description: I live in Alaska and have 3 sons that love to fish.  I have had to come up with some pretty creative ways to prepare salmon, this is by far my family and friends favorite way to eat fresh salmon.  I soak an untreated cedar plank in water and bourbon while they are out fishing for the day and fix the barbeque sauce so that's it is ready to get grilling.....
author: JMCCURTAIN

description: A simple soy sauce and brown sugar marinade, with hints of lemon and garlic, are the perfect salty-sweet complement to rich salmon fillets. Even my 9 year old loves this recipe!
author: tinamenina

description: These salmon patties are delicious for lunch or dinner.
author: Sue

description: This is the best and most delicious salmon recipe, and very easy to prepare. I love maple in everything and put this together one night. My husband totally loved it; he did not like salmon that much until he had this.
author: STARFLOWER

description: This is a recipe for my Grandmother's famous salmon cakes.  It is a family recipe that has been passed down through generations.  Serve with macaroni and cheese or any other type of side dish.
author: JESS4UANDME

description: This is a very simple but delicious way to prepare fresh salmon using just a few ingredients from your pantry.
author: Angela Sing Huey Looi

description: Fire up succulent salmon with an exciting blend of Cajun-style spices!
author: JEFF CALKINS

description: This is a great recipe for beginners! This was my first time making fish and it was a hit. Even my 9 year old daughter who wouldn't dream of eating fish EVER had half of my portion!
author: LADYBLADE

description: Simply seasoned with salt and pepper, these salmon fillets are pan seared with capers, and garnished with slices of lemon.
author: Noreen421

description: This is my favorite recipe! I make this way too often. It's quick and easy! I serve this with rice and broccoli.
author: Tamara

description: Fresh salmon with butter and herbs melts in your mouth; it's truly the best. Serve it with wild rice pilaf and fresh string beans.
author: Deborah Swanson

description: Salmon fillets topped with chopped tomato and green onion, and baked in the oven to perfection for a deliciously quick and simple dinner for any occasion.
author: MAGGIE1205

description: A glaze featuring balsamic vinegar, garlic, honey, white wine and Dijon mustard makes baked salmon fillets extraordinary.
author: ISYBEL

description: This quick salmon dish is perfect for a weeknight dinner. Serve with a side of sauteed spinach and a glass of pinot noir.
author: CHEDDAR97005

description: The perfect way to stretch pricey smoked salmon: Here, it's crumbled in cream cheese with fresh herbs and seasonings.
author: Jay

description: This is the perfect romantic dinner for two when served with an Oregon Pinot Noir, crusty bread, wild rice, and salad.
author: CHEDDAR97005

description: This recipe is the most delicious salmon recipe, easy to prepare and very refreshing. Everyone that ate this dish loved it. I made this recipe, and it is easily my favorite.
author: Leeves

recipeName: Remoulade Sauce a la New Orleans
description: Top your crab, shrimp, lobster, salmon dishes, or seafood po' boy sandwiches with this wonderful cold sauce that has its origins in France and was then popularized in New Orleans.
author: COOKINCOWGIRLS

description: This recipe is a great way to used canned or leftover salmon, and is easily adapted to include whatever spices you like.
author: Marianna

description: Full of flavor with a hint of sweetness, this moist and delicious salmon is ready in under 10 minutes! You may want to add salt before serving if you are using an unsalted Cajun seasoning. I like to use a Misto® sprayer with my own oil, but feel free to use regular cooking spray. For best results, use center-cut fillets that are about an inch thick.
author: France C

recipeName: Alaska Salmon Bake with Pecan Crunch Coating
description: Baked salmon makes an excellent main course!
author: Ann

description: Salmon baked in parchment paper is the best way to steam in great taste.
author: tiger77

description: This is a great recipe for salmon incorporating Mediterranean ingredients and spices. Everyone I've made this for loved it!!
author: ARIEL1O1

description: Easy prep makes this a great recipe for card night.
author: Carol

description: Salmon, cracker crumbs, milk, egg and butter, baked into a loaf.
author: Gloria

description: This is a lighter version of pasta carbonara. For people who want the flavor but not the bacon, smoked salmon is the perfect substitute!
author: DEBNJAMES

description: If you want to prepare salmon without thawing and have it stay warm and moist without overcooking, then this is your recipe!
author: Carol Castellucci Miller

description: Cedar plank salmon can be baked in the oven or barbequed on the grill with this easy recipe.
author: NICOLETTE505

description: I love this recipe, it is absolutely delici-oso! These breaded pan-fried salmon fillets are best served with steamed rice and spring mix salad, or broccoli florets and mashed potatoes, or on a toasted roll for a sandwich.
author: ShareWithMe
